intro: Acourtia veracruzana, commonly known as the Veracruz acourtia, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or disturbed soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, yellow flowers are surrounded by pale green or white ray florets, and it produces small, hard fruits. Acourtia veracruzana is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and shrublands.
